refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: This function sorts an array. Elements will be arranged from lowest to highest when this function has completed.

example.title: sort example
example.programlisting:
<?php

$fruits = array("lemon", "orange", "banana", "apple");
sort($fruits);
reset($fruits);
while (list($key, $val) = each($fruits)) {
    echo "fruits[".$key."] = ".$val."\n";
}

?>
example.screen: fruits[0] = apple fruits[1] = banana fruits[2] = lemon fruits[3] = orange

refsect1.para: The fruits have been sorted in alphabetical order.
The optional second parameter sort_flags may be used to modify the sorting behavior using these values:

Sorting type flags:
SORT_REGULAR - compare items normally
SORT_NUMERIC - compare items numerically
SORT_STRING - compare items as strings

note.para: The second parameter was added in PHP 4.

refsect1.para: See also arsort, asort, ksort, natsort, natcasesort, rsort, usort, array_multisort, and uksort.
